intro: Hieracium bessei, commonly known as the Bessei hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium bessei is often found in open habitats and can form dense colonies, sometimes becoming invasive in certain regions.
